citation.article-title: Pseudoalteromonas translucida sp. nov. and Pseudoalteromonas paragorgicola sp. nov., and emended description of the genus.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pseudoalteromonas translucida sp. nov.
Pseudoalteromonas translucida (trans.lu'ci.da. L. fem. adj. translucida translucent)
Rod-shaped, single cells, about 0.7-0.9 μm in diameter.
Gram-negative.
Motile, with flagella on both poles.
Strictly aerobic.
Chemo-organotroph with respiratory metabolism.
Does not form endospores.
Does not accumulate poly-β-hydroxybutyrate as an intracellular reserve product and does not have an arginine dihydrolase system.
Oxidase- and catalase-positive.
Requires Na+ ions or sea water for growth.
Growth occurs in media with 1-6% NaCl.
Temperature for growth ranges from 4 to 30°C with optimum growth at 25°C.
No growth is detected at 35°C.
The pH for growth ranges from 6.0 to 10.0 with optimum growth at pH 7.5-8.0.
Decomposes gelatin, elastin, Tween 80 and DNA.
Agar and chitin are not hydrolysed.
The main cellular fatty acids are 16:1ω7, 16:0, 17:1ω8 and 18:1ω7 (about 80% of the total).
Isolated from sea water collected from the Sea of Japan.
The G+C content of the DNA is 46.3 mol%.
The type strain is strain KMM 520T (=LMG 19696T=ATCC BAA-315T).
